pathAssistantSteps.info: The Research Office sends the Agreement to the client or other party with a copy to the Researcher. The Researcher may send the Agreement to the client or other party if agreed with the Research Office Contact. If the Agreement is sent by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the Researcher uploads the email and a copy of the Agreement to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab) and notifies the Research Office Contact via chatter. The client or other party may decide to sign the Agreement at this stage, if acceptable.
The Agreement is closed as it did not proceed to execution due to cancellation or withdrawal.
The Research Office drafts the contract for approval. The Research Office contact will contact the Researcher if there are further questions.
The Agreement has been signed by both parties.

The Research Office organises signing of the Agreement by an authorised signatory, once all parties have agreed and returns the signed Agreement to the client or other party. The Research Office notifies the Researcher via Chatter and uploads a fully executed Agreement to the Researcher Portal.  If the fully executed Agreement is returned by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the Researcher uploads the email and a copy of the fully executed Agreement to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab) and notifies the Research Office contact via Chatter.

The Research Office prepares instructions including Agreement timelines, milestones, project budget, intellectual property position, publication requirements and deliverables/outputs. The Research Office will contact the Researcher to clarify or to provide further details, if required.
The Researcher reviews the draft Agreement. When completed, the Researcher will advise Research Office if acceptable via chatter.
